meanings.definition: One who forms an opinion without sufficient evidence.
meanings.sent1: The surmisers in the group quickly jumped to conclusions.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students not to be surmisers and to gather more facts before making assumptions.
meanings.sent3: The surmisers at the party thought the cake was chocolate, but it turned out to be vanilla.
meanings.sent4: The detective's surmisers led him to the wrong suspect in the case.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the surmisers who spread rumors without knowing the truth.
